title: Kevin Hart’s failed ’30 for 30′: I’m the greatest celebrity basketball player of all time | For The Win
text:
By: Michelle R. Martinelli | February 18, 2017 11:27 am Follow @MMartinelli4 
Looking back on his career as a celebrity basketball player, four-time MVP of the All-Star CelebrityGame Kevin Hart hilariously choked up talking about his triumphs and struggles in his failed ESPN “30 for 30: Playing with Hart.” 
“You can go down the list, you can go through every stat — I’m the greatest celebrity basketball player of all time,” Hart says before shifting to his biggest obstacle in the celebrity game: Mo’ne Davis . 
It’s hard not to laugh as the 5-foot-4 comedian talks about getting schooled by Davis — the famous then-13-year-old little league baseball player — two years ago on the court, making comically outrageous accusations about why the teenager was able to break his tough defense. 
“ESPN Films presents a ’30 for 30′ film that will never see the light of day: Playing with Hart.”
